intro: Dissochaeta korthalsii, commonly known as the Korthals' dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and slender, often hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
